result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Pamela A. Stenerson was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • Pamela A. Stenerson was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and DNA Surcharge.
If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Continue with Mental Health Treatment and take all medications as prescribed; sign all releases.

Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA sample.
No Pre-Trial Incarceration credit.
Continue with AODA & continue to comply with treatment recommendations in her aftercare

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Pamela A. Stenerson in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:11 a.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Court states that the defendant had pled guilt by reason of mental disease or defect; conflicting reports in regards to the mental disease or defect by 2 medical persons.
Atty Wallace indicates that his client is willing to withdraw her guilty plea due to mental disease or defect and is going to be pleading no contest.
Court questions the defendant regarding her withdrawal.  
Defendant indicates she is withdrawing her plea due to mental disease or defect and she is doing this freely voluntarily and knowingly; Atty Wallace agrees.
BTC:  Court finds that the defendant is changing her plea freely, voluntarily and knowingly.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - No contest 
Count 3 - Dismissed 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 & 2 and Count 3 is dismissed.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Knaapen makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Wallace makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to her sentencing; Court questions the defendant.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Sentence withheld
Placed on Probation for 24 months 
Continue with AODA & continue to comply with treatment recommendations in her aftercare.
Maintain full-time employment.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Continue with Mental Health Treatment and take all medications as prescribed; sign all releases.
Pay court costs.
Provide DNA sample and pay the DNA Surcharge.
No Pre-Trial Incarceration credit.

Count 2 - 
135 days in jail - sentence credit for days sat in Winnebago.
Sentence credit for days sat in Winnebago of 135.
Pay fine + costs totalling $3,508.
Pay blood draw of $26.45.
34 month DL revocation; Revocation is retroactive to the date of the administrative suspension from the Dept. of Transportation
34 month IID 
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.  To be completed in Winnebago County
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. 
**Set up payment plan today with Clerk of Court's Office.


Count 3 - Dismissed. 
PAC .218

**Any monies posted to be applied to fines/costs.

ADDRESS INFO for Pamela A. Stenerson
Current: 4414 Soda Creek Rd, Apt A, Oshkosh, WI 54901-1039 United States  (Effective: 10-06-2015)
Prior: 1332 Monroe St Apt 6, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States

Defendant Pamela A. Stenerson in court with attorney John H. Wallace. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:39 am Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Matter is set for a plea today.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, Defense has a request.

Atty Wallace addresses the Court, requests his client to fill out huber transfer, requests matter to be rescheduled for one more date.

Defendant will be withdrawing NGI plea.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, provides the Court a copy of paperwork.

A plea agreement has been reached.

Court can go through the Defendant's decision making process.

Court will allow matter adjourned.

Defendant will be pleading to felony count but State will not be requesting a PSI, there is a plea agreement. 

BY THE COURT:
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Plea hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 10:30 am.

David R. Knaapen appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney John Wallace and Pamela Stenerson appeared via telephone.  
10:33 a.m. case is called.   Appearances stated on the record.  
This is a status conference.  
The court and parties received a report from the doctor.  
ADA makes a statement and requests another evaluation of the defendant.  Court questions the ADA re: payment of evaluation
ADA requests the court to authorize the evaluation.
Attorney Wallace replies to the statement and requests the evaluation to take place in Oshkosh.  

The court states it has never appointed another evaluator in this type of situation.  Court states its concerns on the record.  
ADA makes additional argument in support of his request.  
Attorney Wallace replies.

Court is relunctant to spend additional county money for another evaluation.

BTC:
Court denies the request.  

The parties will discuss this further and will notify the court if they reach an agreement.
Next scheduled court date is May 18, 2015.  

Bond is ordered continued.
10:51 a.m. case is concluded.

Attorney John H. Wallace in court, defendant Pamela A. Stenerson not in court, in custody via video at Winnebago Mental Health Institute. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:28 a.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.
Attorney Wallace makes statement as to the history of the matter.  There was Ch. 51 and this individual failed to appear due to that filing.
Attorney Wallace Requests a signature bond 
Court questions the defendant re: address.  Will be living in a group home in Oshkosh.  
ADA requests a bond 
Court quashes the warrant.
State recdommends bond - $2000 sig bond:   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.    Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.  Advise court of any change of address.
No objections to the bond by defense attorney.
$2000 sig bond:   Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Do not operate a vehicle without a valid driver's license.    Do not operate a vehicle unless absolutely sober.  Keep the court and her attorney of her current address.  

Attorney requests the social to advise of defendant's current address and change of any address.

Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.

Attorney and defendant waives preliminary hearing.  
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
State files Information.
Defendant's attorney received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
NG and NG by reason of mental disease

Will appoint a doctor to complete evaluation.
Dr. Ralph Baker in Oskosh will be appointed and will prepare the appointment.  
Court will provide letter to counsel for any additional information

Court will not be required to be present at the pre-trial.  
ADA questions re: location of the defendant on the next scheduled court hearing.  
11:40 a.m. case is in recess.  


  Status conference scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 10:30 am.
for Documents and Motion for Discovery

Defendant Pamela A. Stenerson not in court. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:29 AM Court calls case.
Defendant does not appear.
Court reviews the file.

Atty Cousins addresses the Court, citation indicated 9 am, madatory court date. There should also be a bond in this case as well. 
Paper file only has a complaint. Atty Cousins does not see a bond.
Court reviews the electronic file. 

State requests criminal warrant and if any bond was posted, to be forfeited.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds probable cause in the complaint.
Court orders a criminal warrant.
Court will not order bond forfeited at this time.
